sentences: Kristinia Jamie DeBarge (; born March 8, 1990) is an American singer, songwriter, dancer and actress.
section: N/A

sentences: DeBarge first appeared on national television in 2003 as a contestant on the American Idol spin-off, American Juniors.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2009, DeBarge signed a contract with the Island Records department Sodapop, releasing her debut album, Exposed, in July of the same year.
section: N/A

sentences: Life and career ==
section: == Life and career ==
== Life and career == | === Family and early life ===

sentences: Family and early life ===
section: == Life and career == | === Family and early life ===

sentences: Born in 1990, DeBarge is the daughter of James DeBarge.
section: == Life and career == | === Family and early life ===

sentences: DeBarge began singing when she was 3 years old, but did not begin to take it seriously until she was 12.
section: == Life and career == | === Family and early life ===

sentences: When she was 12, her father took her into a recording studio where they worked until 4 A.M. recording a duet titled "How I Feel Inside", which made her father realize that she was serious about beginning a singing career.
section: == Life and career == | === Family and early life ===

sentences: During Summer 2003 she was a contestant on the American Idol spin-off, American Juniors.
section: == Life and career == | === Family and early life ===

sentences: DeBarge progressed to the semi-final round of 20 contestants.
section: == Life and career == | === Family and early life ===

sentences: She was featured in the first group of ten semi-finalists and sang the song "Reflection" from the Disney film Mulan.
section: == Life and career == | === Family and early life ===

sentences: However, she was not one of the five to progress from that group into the final ten.
section: == Life and career == | === Family and early life ===

sentences: DeBarge is of mixed race.
section: == Life and career == | === Family and early life ===

sentences: Her father is of African American, English and French Canadian descent.
section: == Life and career == | === Family and early life ===

sentences: Her mother is of Mexican, Irish, Scottish, English, Norwegian, Spanish and French descent.
section: == Life and career == | === Family and early life ===

sentences: DeBarge's ancestors on her mother's side include, 6th great grandfather
section: == Life and career == | === Family and early life ===

sentences: Robert Sevier and 6th great granduncle  John Sevier (first member of the Watauga Association/founding father of Tennessee), and first cousin twice removed Elías Nandino, a Mexican poet and confidant of Frida Kahlo.
section: == Life and career == | === Family and early life ===

sentences: Among her mother's distant relatives are King Robert I of France and Lady Margaret Erskine.
section: == Life and career == | === Family and early life ===

== Life and career == | === 2009: Exposed ===

sentences: Exposed =
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: Exposed ===
== Life and career == | === 2009: Exposed ===

sentences: At 14, DeBarge was introduced to Kenneth "Babyface" Edmonds.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: Exposed ===

sentences: She worked with him for five years and, two days before her nineteenth birthday, signed to a new division of Island Def Jam Records founded by Edmonds and Jeff Burroughs called Sodapop Records.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: Exposed ===

sentences: DeBarge's first single "Goodbye" off her debut album Exposed was released in April 2009.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: Exposed ===

sentences: "Goodbye" met with commercial success in the United States, the single debuted at number 75 on the Billboard Hot 100 singles chart, and later reached a peak of number 15 on the chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: Exposed ===

sentences: The single was also a success in Canada, where it reached a peak of number 15 on the Canadian Hot 100.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: Exposed ===

sentences: Exposed, was released on July 28, 2009.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: Exposed ===

sentences: Exposed received generally positive reviews from music critics, based on an aggregate score of 69/100 from Metacritic.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: Exposed ===

sentences: In the United States, the album debuted at number 23 on the Billboard 200.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: Exposed ===

sentences: DeBarge also opened up for pop singer Britney Spears, during Spears' 2009 world tour, The Circus Starring: Britney Spears.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009: Exposed ===

sentences: After Exposed and new album Young & Restless ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–13: After Exposed and new album Young & Restless ===

sentences: In November 2009, The Wet Seal, Inc., a leading specialty retailer to young women, announced a partnership with DeBarge which included a collection of fashion pieces selected by DeBarge.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–13: After Exposed and new album Young & Restless ===

sentences: In January 2010, DeBarge received an NAACP Image Award nomination for "Outstanding New Artist."
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–13: After Exposed and new album Young & Restless ===

sentences: DeBarge made an appearance in School Gyrls, which premiered on Nickelodeon in March 2010.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–13: After Exposed and new album Young & Restless ===

sentences: In September 2012, DeBarge released her single "Cry Wolf" from her exclusive Japan album Young & Restless.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–13: After Exposed and new album Young & Restless ===

sentences: In October 2012, the "Cry Wolf" music video was premiered on her VEVO artist page.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–13: After Exposed and new album Young & Restless ===

sentences: On November 9, 2012, DeBarge made her acting debut in "Christmas in Compton" starring Keith David, Omar Gooding, Sheryl Lee Ralph and Eric Roberts.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–13: After Exposed and new album Young & Restless ===

sentences: On April 3, 2013, DeBarge released another single ("Ignite") from Young & Restless exclusively to Japan through Manhattan Records.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–13: After Exposed and new album Young & Restless ===

sentences: The song peaked at number six one day after its release on the Japanese iTunes R&B Chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–13: After Exposed and new album Young & Restless ===

sentences: On May 29, 2013, DeBarge released another single from the album, "Higher".
section: == Life and career == | === 2009–13: After Exposed and new album Young & Restless ===

== Life and career == | === 2014: Third studio album and School Dance ===

sentences: Third studio album and School Dance ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2014: Third studio album and School Dance ===

sentences: DeBarge was featured on Redrama's new single and music video "Let Go" on January 17, 2014.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014: Third studio album and School Dance ===

sentences: DeBarge and Redrama performed on live television for Finland's finals of the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 at the Barona Areena in Espoo on February 1, 2014.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014: Third studio album and School Dance ===

sentences: The single was a success in Finland, where it reached No. 1 on NRJ's Top 10 list on February 4, 2014 and No. 1 on Spotify on February 7, 2014.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014: Third studio album and School Dance ===

sentences: The single reached a peak of No. 3 on the Finnish Single Charts.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014: Third studio album and School Dance ===

sentences: On February 25, 2014, the single reached a peak of No. 1 on the Finnish Airplay Charts.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014: Third studio album and School Dance ===

sentences: DeBarge started working on her third studio album in March 2014 with Adonis Shropshire.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014: Third studio album and School Dance ===

sentences: DeBarge's second acting role came on July 2, 2014 in Nick Cannon's directorial debut School Dance where she plays the lead female role, Anastacia.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014: Third studio album and School Dance ===

sentences: The film has an ensemble cast of Bobb'e J. Thompson, Mike Epps, Luenell, Katt Williams, George Lopez, and The Rangers.
section: == Life and career == | === 2014: Third studio album and School Dance ===

sentences: On January 5, 2015, DeBarge and Adonis Shropshire started exclusively releasing new music to YouTube.

sentences: She entitled the project "New Music Mondays".
section: == Life and career == | === 2015: New Music Mondays and Growing Up Hip Hop ===

sentences: On July 8, 2015, WE tv announced it would mine the stories of real-life rap industry families on "Growing Up Hip Hop."
section: == Life and career == | === 2015: New Music Mondays and Growing Up Hip Hop ===

sentences: Set to air January 7, 2016, the six-episode reality series stars DeBarge, Angela Simmons, Damon "Boogie" Dash, Romeo Miller, Egypt Criss, and TJ Mizell and some of their famous parents appeared on the show.
section: == Life and career == | === 2015: New Music Mondays and Growing Up Hip Hop ===

sentences: DeBarge announced in an interview on September 2015 that she would be releasing a new studio album around the premiere of Growing Up Hip Hop.

section: == Life and career == | === 2016 - Present: New Music ===

sentences: The online company launched on November 23, 2018 with the “Amethyst Collection” (a 17 piece vegan brush set), the “Aplysina Blender” (a makeup sponge) and the “3D Inlashuation Mascara” (a waterproof and smudge free mascara that sold out within minutes).
section: == Life and career == | === 2018: Krissy D Cosmetics ===
